# braintrustdata_views (Data Source)

Lists Braintrust views using API-native filters.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# List views for an object.
data "braintrustdata_views" "all" {
  # replace with real IDs or wire from data/resource
  object_id   = "proj-abc123"
  object_type = "project"
}

# Optional API-native filters.
data "braintrustdata_views" "filtered" {
  object_id   = "proj-abc123"
  object_type = "project"
  view_name   = "default"
  view_type   = "projects"
  limit       = 10
}

locals {
  default_views = [
    for view in data.braintrustdata_views.all.views : view
    if view.name == "default"
  ]
}

output "view_lists" {
  value = {
    all_ids      = data.braintrustdata_views.all.ids
    filtered_ids = data.braintrustdata_views.filtered.ids
    default_view = length(local.default_views) > 0 ? local.default_views[0].id : null
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `object_id` (String) The object ID to scope the view listing.
- `object_type` (String) The object type to scope the view listing.

### Optional

- `ending_before` (String) Optional pagination cursor to fetch views before this ID.
- `filter_ids` (List of String) Optional list of view IDs to filter by. Maps to repeated `ids` query parameters.
- `limit` (Number) Optional max number of views to return.
- `starting_after` (String) Optional pagination cursor to fetch views after this ID.
- `view_name` (String) Optional exact view name filter.
- `view_type` (String) Optional view type filter.

### Read-Only

- `ids` (List of String) List of returned view IDs.
- `views` (Attributes List) List of views. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--views))

<a id="nestedatt--views"></a>
### Nested Schema for `views`

Read-Only:

- `created` (String) The timestamp when the view was created.
- `deleted_at` (String) The timestamp when the view was deleted, if deleted.
- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the view.
- `name` (String) The name of the view.
- `object_id` (String) The object ID the view applies to.
- `object_type` (String) The object type the view applies to.
- `user_id` (String) The ID of the user who created the view.
- `view_type` (String) The table type this view corresponds to.
